info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:14PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND EAST CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 514 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Santa Fe, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Pecos, Canada De Los Alamos, Lamy, Glorieta, Agua Fria, and La Cienega. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 274 and 306. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 278 and 290. State Road 63 between Mile Markers 2 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
